summary: This is a motion filed by Jeffrey Epstein's attorney to correct a scrivener's error in the sentencing documents related to his 2008 plea agreement. The motion clarifies that Epstein's community control sentence was to begin only after completion of his jail sentences, not concurrently. It reveals details about the plea negotiation timeline and judicial assignments.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who entered a guilty plea on June 30, 2008, and is subject to jail sentences followed by community control.

persons.name: Deborah Pucillo
persons.context: Substituted for Judge Sandra McSorley on June 30, 2008, and presided over Epstein's guilty plea in Criminal Division "W".

persons.name: Sandra McSorley
persons.context: Permanent judge assigned to Criminal Division "W" who signed the Order of Community Control nunc pro tunc on July 18, 2008, which contained the scrivener's error.

persons.name: Lanna Belohlavek
persons.context: Prosecutor in the State Attorney's Office who received a copy of the motion and did not object to the correction of the scrivener's error.

persons.name: Jack A. Goldberger
persons.context: Epstein's attorney who filed this motion on behalf of the defendant from the law firm Atterbury, Goldberger & Weiss.

connections.description: Goldberger filed this motion on Epstein's behalf as his defense attorney to correct sentencing documents.
Belohlavek is the prosecutor in Epstein's case who did not object to the motion to correct the sentencing error.
Pucillo substituted for McSorley on June 30, 2008, when McSorley was not sitting, and McSorley later corrected Pucillo's oversight in signing the Order of Community Control.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered guilty pleas in Criminal Division "W" before Judge Deborah Pucillo, resolving the case through plea negotiations that required resolution by this date.

events.title: Order of Community Control Signed
events.description: Judge Sandra McSorley signed an Order of Community Control nunc pro tunc to June 30, 2008, to correct the substitute judge's oversight, but it contained a scrivener's error regarding when community control began.

events.title: Motion to Correct Scrivener's Error Filed
events.description: Epstein's attorney filed this motion to clarify that community control should begin only after jail sentences are completed, not on June 30, 2008.

locations: 401 North Dixie Highway, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401
250 Australian Avenue South, Suite 1400 West Palm Beach, Florida 33401
keyFacts: Epstein's plea agreement required resolution by June 30, 2008, and involved consecutive jail sentences totaling 18 months followed by 12 months of community control.
A scrivener's error in the Order of Community Control could be misinterpreted to suggest community control began on June 30, 2008, rather than after jail sentences.
Judge Deborah Pucillo presided over Epstein's guilty plea as a substitute for Judge Sandra McSorley, who later corrected the oversight in signing the community control order.
The prosecution did not object to correcting the sentencing error, indicating agreement between parties on the intended sentence structure.
This document reveals procedural details about how Epstein's 2008 plea agreement was administratively handled and corrected.
